result.markdown:
::: {.question} **Net Proceeds in an SEO** Orion AutoTech executed a seasoned equity offering (SEO) of 10 million shares at $50.53 per share. Of these, 5.7 million were primary (new shares issued by the company) and 4.3 million were secondary (sold by existing investors). Assume the underwriter charges 5% of the gross proceeds as an underwriting fee which is shared proportionately between the primary and secondary shares. ::: {.question-block}
1. The amount of money raised by the company (in million USD) is:
✅ Net to issuer = (Primary Shares × Price) − Underwriter fee on primary = (5.7 × $50.53) − (5% × $288.02 million) = $288.02 million − $14.4 million = **$273.6 million**.
::: ::: {.question-block}
2. The amount of money raised by the VC (in million USD) is:
✅ Net to VCs = (Secondary Shares × Price) − Underwriter fee on secondary = (4.3 × $50.53) − (5% × $217.28 million) = $217.28 million − $10.86 million = **$206.4 million**.
::: ::: {.question-block}
3. The amount of money the underwriter will earn (in million USD) is:
✅ Fee = (Total Shares × Price) × Fee Rate = (10 × $50.53) × 5% = $505.3 million × 5% = **$25.3 million**.
::: :::
